docs.text: a couple of months ago , when i first downloaded the face/off trailer from the net , my initial reaction was a fourteen carrot gold 'yawn' .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: followed swiftly by a press of my computers delete key , not wanting to waste six or seven megabytes of precious space on this piss-poor trailer .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: then i started reading the first wave of reviews from the u . s . . . . . unique . . . excellent . . . . must-see .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: well , i thought still skeptical , i suppose i might as well go see it when it gets here .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: 'here' , of course , was still three months away .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i'll admit , when i trotted off to see this film , the only john woo movie i had seen before was the fairly enjoyable but highly forgetable broken arrow .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i'd heard good things about his previous work with movies like hard boiled , but his films were definitely not on my must-see list .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: that , let me tell you , has changed completely .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i knew this fact only five minutes into the film , after the brilliantly shot and acted opening sequence where sean archer loses his son blew me off my feet .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the acting throughout the film is staggeringly good for an action flick .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: seriously .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i've never been a big john travolta fan , but he , like cage , perfectly suited his role in the movie . . . . . sorry ,
docs.label: positive

docs.text: make that 'roles' in the movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: even travolta's great performance , however , paled in comparison to cage's character portrayals .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: my favourite cage scene was definitely when he was crashed out in compardre dietrich hassler's hideout .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: half drugged out of his mind , he sits there reclining back in a chair talking about his son's death from castor's perspective - " doesn't it just break your heart . " he mutters coldly .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: now don't go thinking from the previous comments about brilliant acting that this is a drama focused movie - it's not .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: that's what really makes this movie unique .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's an action movie with brilliantly portrayed characters . . . . . not a common mix at all .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: suspension of disbelief is paramount in this movie though . . . . . that's
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the only way to overlook the fact that travolta and cage fire around 5671 rounds at each other . . . . and
docs.label: positive

docs.text: never hit .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: several action scenes are just so well choreographed that they just make wish that you could press 'rewind' and watch it over again .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the part where archer and troy have a stand off on either side of a double-sided mirror is just plain brilliant .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: whilst cage's and travolta's performances would be enough alone to sustain most movies , the lesser characters are just as intriguing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: joan allen , who usually sticks to the straight drama movies , plays her part perfectly as archer's long suffering wife .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i like the fact that her character didn't end up toting a gun at the end of the movie . . . it
docs.label: positive

docs.text: would have wrecked her potrayal .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: gina gershon was surprising to say the least as castor troy's mistreated girlfriend . . . . . make that * one of * castor troy's mistreated girlfriends .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: other movies would have used her character as just window dressing . . . a
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sex object , but instead her character is very strong and independent .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: dominique swain , who plays archer's daughter , also does a nice job , though her character is not as explored as much as allen's or gershon's .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: faults ? well . . . there were some i have to say .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: first , the movie's ending , whilst being very good overall , was a bit too drawn out for it's own good .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after the two combatants begin duelling again after the final boat crash you can't help but think - " geez , are you guys nuclear powered or what ? " .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there were certain bits that weren't handled properly , like where archer appears safe and sound on solid ground after jumping off the converted oil platform/prison - more explanation here would have been nice .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: overall , this movie was not perfect .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but i thought it was about as close as an action movie has ever came to perfect .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: many critics have claimed that this movie will change the way action movies are made . . . . . i
docs.label: positive

docs.text: certainly hope so .
docs.label: positive
